data.title: Loganair
data.meta_description: Loganair (ICAO: LOG, IATA: LM) was the flag carrier of Scotland based at Glasgow Airport, Scotland. It was the main regional airline of the UK but it also flew internationally. Loganair is now defunct. Loganair had a diverse fleet but it only consisted of narrow body aircraft. Loganair flies to...
data.text:
Loganair (ICAO: LOG, IATA: LM) was the flag carrier of Scotland based at Glasgow Airport, Scotland. It was the main regional airline of the UK but it also flew internationally. Loganair is now defunct.

Fleet[]

Loganair had a diverse fleet but it only consisted of narrow body aircraft.

Aircraft In Service On Order Capacity Notes ATR 42-500 4 5 48 ATR 72-600 2 70 Britten-Norman Islander 2 8 De Havilland Canada DHC-6-310 Twin Otter 1 19 Viking Air DHC-6-400 Twin Otter 2 19 Operated on Behalf of the Scottish Government Embraer ERJ-135 4 37 Embraer ERJ-145 13 49 Saab 340B 12 43 Total 40 5

Cargo Aircraft In Service On Order ATR 72-500F 1 Saab 340AF 2 Saab 340BF 2 Total 4 0

Destinations[]

Loganair flies to over 40 destinations.

Livery[]

History[]

Loganair was founded in late 2019 by Aviation2008 but after a while became unoperated. After the launch of ConnectJet International in April 2020, Loganair came back and restarted with a flight from Glasgow Airport - Campbelltown Airport in the Twin Otter. It is now defunct.

Records[]

Loganair was the only airline that had scheduled service to an airport with a beach as it's runway, Barra. It uses the Twin Otter and connects Barra to Glasgow.

It also operated the world's shortest commercial flight, between Westray and Papa Westray.

Trivia[]

The Flybe Twin Otter in GeoFS was actually a Loganair aircraft IRL, the registration G-BVVK was in the Loganir livery IRL and in GeoFS if you go to the front of the aircrafts nose, it actually says, operated by Loganair.
